subject: Re: How to create data-driven tests? II!
msgSnippet: ... and ... class ... dbUnit ... How about: class Script implements Test { public int countTestCases() { return 1; } public void run(TestResult result) {
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., NOUSHI Reda <noushi@e...> wrote:
> Hi all,
> My point is slightly different. I want to create data-driven tests
> assuming that the data is what defines the test case's steps!
> My input file would be something like that:
> ? this
> ! that
> ? this2
> ? this3
> ! that2
>
> And I want it to produce something like:
> void Test1()
> {
> //do this
>
> //assert that
>
> //do this2
>
> //do this3
>
> //assert that2
> }
>
> I know I can write some script or class that parses the input file
and
> generates the test case class, but I want something like a single
class
> that does this job for me, like that of dbUnit. The problem with
dbUnit
> is that the data is what the test case runs on...

How about:

class Script implements Test {
public int countTestCases() {
return 1;
}

public void run(TestResult result) {
foreach Step step in steps do
step.run(result);
}
}

You can build Script instances from a file, with a Step for each
line, and bundle a bunch of Scripts into a TestSuite to be run along
with ordinary TestCases.

Does this solve your problem?

Kent
